events.name: Google I/O Extended '17 New Delhi
events.description:
About I/O

Google I/O is an annual developer festival held at the outdoor Shoreline Amphitheatre. Each year, Google I/O provides a huge quantity of educational videos, code labs, and blog posts to help developers keep up with the latest in technology. 

This event will showcase some of the major announcements from I/O, in-person experiences and insider information from developers who were there, and provide access to hands-on code labs so that developers can try out the new technology!

About I/O Extended

I/O Extended events include a variety of options for developers—from live streaming sessions to local demos, hackathons, code-labs, and more. 

In 2016, there were 534 Google I/O Extended events in 100 countries around the world! In the past GDG New Delhi has been doing I/O Extended event in New Delhi from the last five years.

We are bringing to you another version of the I/O Extended. Our first meetup on meetup.com . Come out and join us for a day full of fun and meaningful sessions.

This event will have pizza and beverages provided by a sponsorship from Google Developers. There may also be some swag. If you are interested in sponsoring  please contact us at [masked] .

----------------------------------------------------------------

Hey People!

Here's the details of the event:

• 10:00 am - 10.30 am - Registrations (Be on time and with Invitation only!)

• 10.35 am - 10.59 am

• Session 1:

• Speaker: Nishant Srivastava

• Topic: Welcome to GDG, What's new at I/O

• 11.00 am - 12 pm

• Session 2:

• Speaker: Punit Chawla

• Topic: UX and UI Bloom

• 12 pm - 12.45 pm

• Session 3:

• Abhinav Tyagi

• Topic: Android Things and Jarvis 

• 12.45 pm - 1.30 pm

• Hungry? Grab some food! It's on us!

• 1.30 pm - 2.30 pm

• Session 4:

• Speaker: Arpan Garg

• Topic: Let's break the Ice. I want to know you all!

• 2.30 pm - 3.30 pm

• Session 5:

• Speaker: Asheesh Sharma

• Topic: App Performance and Optimization Techniques

• 3.30 pm - 4.30 pm

• The best part: Networking

• Make new techie friends, get guidance or just chit chat!

• And we promise to meet again.

Make sure you attend this event if you're RSVP status is confirmed and you've received the confirmation email. This will make you eligible for the upcoming events. Else please pass on the invitation by changing your RSVP status so that someone else can grab the opportunity!

Important!

Your RSVP only shows your interest. It is not a confirmation. The emails for confirmation will be sent to the shortlisted attendees soon. The confirmation email is a must to attend the event!

UPDATE - 16th May, 2017

Confirmation mails have been delivered! Everyone in the Current RSVP YES list, please check your emails.

Directions to reach venue

Take the Yellow line metro to Huda City Center metro station.
Next, take Uber/Ola/Auto to Plot no. 18, Institutional Area, Sector 32.


UPDATE - 17th May, 2017

If anyone in the current RSVP 'YES" list has not received the confirmation mail from the organizers, please let us know in the comments. This is the final call. Entry to the venue will be only on the basis of confirmation mails.


UPDATE - 19th May, 2017

Hello again everyone, looking at the recent messages of the members in RSVP 'Yes' telling us that they haven't received the confirmation mails, we have sent a final [Entry Pass] to all the confirmed attendees. This overrides all the other previous mails and will be the sole criteria for your entry to the event. 

If your RSVP status is YES and haven't got this mail, then please message Arpan Garg from the organizers ASAP.

Please make sure to show this mail at the time of registration to be able to attend the event as we have limited seats!

See you all tomorrow :)

events.name: Regular Meetup
events.description:
Hey Developers!

Get ready for a Tech Meetup this time!

We're going to have a 2 super cool sessions spread over 2 hours!

Update: 26th May, 2017

We have to postpone the meetup to the next weekend as one of the speakers is unavailable and we currently don't have anyone to fill in.

Taking a moment, we'd like to encourage you all to submit your proposals to take sessions with GDG ND so that we can get more people to come up and take tech sessions and share with the community! Here's the link: GITHUB. Just create an issue on the github link mentioned and we'll reach out to you ASAP.

More details coming in soon!

Update: 2nd June, 2017

What's up people!

We are now planned for our next meetup. Here's the details of the sessions:

Date: 4th June, 2017


Time: 10.00 am

Speaker: Shubham Gupta

Topic: Being An Efficient Android Developer - Various Optimizations and Under The Hood Problems

Level: Intermediate

Time: 11.00 am

Speaker: Gaurav Gogia

Topic: Go (Language) For Everyone

Level: Beginner

We're going to roll out the entry passes on emails soon and those will be required to attend the sessions as we have limited space.

Any questions? Feel free to shoot a message/email to the organizers or comment below!

Update:

Entry Pass Emails have been sent to the shortlisted attendees. If you are in the RSVP 'YES' list and have somehow not received, the mail, please send a message to the organizers and we'll get back to you!

Let's catch up on Sunday!

Update: 3rd June, 2017

We've got 10 more seats! If your RSVP is 'YES' and you don't have the entry pass mail, send a message to the organizers with your email id! These are 2 exciting sessions you don't want to miss!

events.name: Android Day

venue.name: ThoughtWorks Gurgaon
venue.address_1: 6th Floor, Tower B, Building No. 14, DLF Cyber City Phase III, Sector 24 & 25A Gurgaon, Haryana 122002

events.description:
From 1.0 to 8.0, Android has come a long way. Along the way there’ve been some amazing devices, innovations, millions of apps, users and the amazing developers.

Announcing our next event ‘A Cool Day With Android’ scheduled on 30th July, 2017 at ThoughtWorks, Gurgaon. With some amazing speakers and community members, this is your chance to know what’s the latest going on in the world of Android. We will be covering talks, demos or codelabs on RxJava with Android, Android Architecture Components and other intermediate-advanced Android Topics.

Agenda of the day to be announced soon. Stay tuned!

Please Note: This event is invite only and we are not opening RSVPs on Meetup . To request an invite, please register here ( https://goo.gl/yHT44n )


Update: 25th July, 2017

And here's the Agenda of the Day!

• 10:30am - 11:00am: Registrations and Welcome Note
[Arpan Garg and Rohan Arora, GDG ND]

• 11:00am - 12:00pm: RxJava with Android Made Easy
[Amit Shekhar, Mindorks]

• 12:05pm - 12:50pm: Android Architecture Components - Light at the end of tunnel?
[Ashesh Bharadwaj, Udacity]

• 13:00pm - 13.30pm: App/Project Demos!

• 13.30pm - 14.00: Hungry? Me too! Let's have some food.

• 14.00pm - 14.45pm: A Shot of Espresso
[Harsh Naraini & Prateek Jain, ThoughtWorks]

• 14.50pm - 15.35pm: Intro to Android Instant Apps
[Prachi Tyagi & Sumit Gupta, ThoughtWorks]

• 15.35pm - 16.00pm: Closing Note & Networking!

Are you excited? We surely are!

PS - The RSVP mails start rolling tonight.

Update 30th July, 2017

Important: Everyone who's got the [Entry Passes]  please bring a Govt. Id as it would be required for entering the venue. 

See you all!

UPDATE: 4th October, 2017

And here are the details for the DevFest 2017! 

Registration Link is at the bottom!

DevFest will be taking place at 3 locations across Delhi/NCR on the same day with different sessions and speakers at each location!

NOIDA: To The New

GURUGRAM: Investopad

DELHI: Coding Ninjas

You have to choose one location out of Delhi / Noida / Gurugram and we will shortlist the attendees from everyone who has selected the location

The details of the awesome sessions which are going to take place:

## Android Track ( To The New, Noida ) Sessions ## 

• [10:30 AM - 11:15 AM] Ashesh Bhardwaj: Overview of Graphics in Android

• [11:20 AM - 11:50 AM] Ishan Khanna: Android Debugging on Steroids

• [11:55 AM - 12:50 PM] Bharat Ghimire & Navkrishna: Constraint Layout

• [12:55 PM - 1:30 PM] Let's have lunch!

• [1:35 PM - 2:15 PM] Garima Jain: Dagger 2 Android: Defeat the Dhaka

• [2:20 PM - 2:50 PM] Harshad Jagtap: Lessons in User Onboarding

• [3:00 PM - 3:40 PM] Harshit Dwivedi: Deep Dive with ROOM Database

• [3:40 PM - 4:00 PM] Networking - The Best Part!

## Web Track ( Investopad, Gurugram ) ##

• [10:30 AM - 11:20 AM] Arun Michael Dsouza: The Era of Module Bundlers

• [11:30 AM - 12:10 PM] Neha Sharma: IOT with Google Assistant

• [12:15 PM - 12:45 PM] Jaswant Singh: Serverless with Google Cloud

• [12:50 PM - 1:25 PM] Let's have lunch!

• [1:30 PM - 2:00 PM] Muhammad Falak R Wani: Docker, why should I care?

• [2:05 PM - 3:05 PM] Smriti Chawla & Bharat Sinha: Progressive Web Apps | Offline First

• [3:10 PM - 3:55 PM] Deepak Pathania: Performance Optimisation for the mobile web.

• [3:55 PM - 4:10 PM] Networking: The Best Part!

## Mixed Track ( Delhi ) ## ( 2 Parallel Tracks )

Track 1

• [10:30 AM - 11:15 AM] Abhinav Tyagi: Let's Add Intelligence - Building a Google Assistant Bot

• [11:20 AM - 12:10 PM] Shivank Shekhar: VR with Google (Web VR & Blocks)

• [12:20 PM - 12:55 PM] It's Lunch!

• [1:00 PM - 1:30 PM] Naman Kumar: Progressive Web Apps With Polymer

• [1:35 PM - 2:00 PM] Prateek Gupta: Tidbits of Kotlin

• [2:05 PM - 2:35 PM] Dilpreet Singh: Ember JS - Introduction to Front End Framework

• [2:35 PM - 3:15 PM] Kartik Arora: Getting Started With Constraint Layout 


Track 2

• [10:30 AM - 11:15 AM] Raunaq: Understanding Android Auto

• [11:20 AM - 12:10 PM] Surbhi Dhingra: Android Application Architecture - Best Practices

• [12: 20 PM - 12:55 PM] It's Lunch!

• [1:00 PM - 1:30 PM] Ishan Guliani: Shrinking it down to scale it up

• [1:35 PM - 2:00 PM] Anubha Kushwaha: Exploring the power of Open Source

• [2:05 PM - 2:45 PM] Asheesh Sharma: Rewriting architecture using Rx Java + MVP + Dagger 2

• [2:45 PM - 3:15 PM] Punit Chawla: User Experience Design For Developers

• [3:20 PM - 3:50 PM] Tushar Tuteja: Using the Vision API with Ruby

Finally, Register On This Link! -- [Registrations Closed]

P.S. There can be updates in the sessions, however the theme at each venue will remain the same.

We'll keep you updated. :)

events.name: HACK-EAM 2018

venue.name: Netaji Subhash Institute Of Technology
venue.address_1: Azad Hind Fauj Marg, Sec-3, Dwarka, New Delhi - 110078

events.description:
GDG New Delhi & TEAMC 2018 bring to you an unconventional, pre-conference Hackathon- HACKEAM aimed at providing a unique platform for students and professionals to spread out to different places within the country which are rife with developmental opportunities and apply their potential to tackle their challenges. In this endeavour, they will be supported by a team comprising professionals and people from different walks of life.

GDG New Delhi is a partner in the event.

Registrations are open, for more information, please visit: http://www.hackeam.tech (http://www.hackeam.tech/)

The main objective of the hackathon is to sensitize students and professionals about existing problems of the under privileged and lesser developed sections of our society and providing a platform whereby they can proactively develop and showcase technological solutions for these challenges.

The hackathon will be conducted through the multiple tracks, rephrased as “Treks” because they involve visits to places of interest, stay and interaction with local communities.

events.name: Google Assistant: Build Actions For Your Community
events.description:
[LATEST UPDATE: 16th March, 2018]: All seats filled up, see you tomorrow everyone. Remember to bring your Laptops and Entry Passes!

15th MARCH, 2018: Second round of RSVPs rolled out. Entry Passes also rolled out for people who confirmed presence. RSVPs forms to close soon.

15TH MARCH, 2018: First round of RSVPs rolled out, confirm fast before the forms are closed!

12TH MARCH, 2018: Registration forms rolled out! Okay Google!
Ever said that? And what did you tell/ask after it.

It's time to make your own conversations with the Google Assistant!
As a part of the Build Actions For Your Community which is a Global Series of Study Jams, we'd like to announce our next exciting meetup.

The aim of this meetup is to take you through the following:
- Learn to Design Conversations [The good and the better]
- Make a basic conversation with the Google Assistant using DialogFlow
- Discuss more ideas and help you take your DialogFlow conversation live for everyone to use

Here's the link to Register: https://goo.gl/forms/MRE9jM1oNxD8TkO83

events.name: Google Cloud: Building For The Next Billion

venue.name: SocialCops
venue.address_1: 3rd Floor, Building No. 261, Lane No 5, Westend Marg, Said-ul-Ajaib, Saket, Saiyad ul Ajaib, Sainik Farm, New Delhi, Delhi 11003

events.description:
[LATEST UPDATE: 23rd March, 2018]: 2nd round of RSVPs and 1st round of Entry Passes emailed! RSVP forms close soon.

23rd March, 2018: First round of RSVPs rolled out! We will start mailing the Entry Passes tonight. Please make sure you fill the RSVP form to get one!

Here's some brief about the exciting sessions, stay tuned for more info!

• What we'll do
Session 1 -
Build a Node.js Web App using Google Cloud Platform
Description:
In this codelab, you'll learn how to integrate Google Cloud Platform services into a Node.js web application to store data, upload images, and authenticate users.
Duration: 45 minutes - 1 hour
Speaker: Jaswant Sandhu - Founder, JS Lovers

Session 2 -
Kubernetes on Google Cloud Platform
Description:
You will get to learn what is Kubernetes, why it is required and how do we quickly set it up on Google Cloud
Duration: 45 minutes- 1 hour
Speaker: Yatin Taluja - Product Lead at SocialCops

Session 3:
Scaling human-aided data enrichment
Description:
Basics of entity recognition, introduction to data enrichment framework, and how to improve data processes through a human-in-the-loop system
Duration: 45 minutes- 1 hour
Speaker: Aakash Tandon - Data Engineer at SocialCops

More sessions coming soon...

Here's the link to Register: https://goo.gl/forms/K26AZNE1lJQgYk0z2

events.name: Vuejs Meetup

venue.name: SocialCops
venue.address_1: 3rd Floor, Building No. 261, Lane No 5, Westend Marg, Said-ul-Ajaib, Saket, Saiyad ul Ajaib, Sainik Farm, New Delhi, Delhi 11003

events.description:
This event is invite only. Register yourself at https://goo.gl/forms/YbTbpUR1DHTGxdcs1

SocialCops & GDG New Delhi are collaborating for a Vuejs meetup on 13th May 2018. On the agenda is learning Vuejs - The smallest learning curve for the largest amount of features!

Here is an overview of the sessions:

1. "How were your favourite sites built a decade ago?" by Nishant Arora (Frontend Engineer, SocialCops) There was no React, no Angular, or our beloved Vue. Almost everybody used jQuery. Companies with resources built their own custom frameworks on top of jQuery and vanilla JS. Let’s talk about how things transformed, and why?

2. "What is Vue" by Rahul Kadyan (Developer, Myntra; Core Team Member at Vuejs) - Overview of Vuejs ecosystem.

3. "Create a chrome plugin using Vue.js" (Hands-on session) by Krishna Sumanth (Frontend Engineer, SocialCops) Always wanted a create a chrome plugin, but didn’t know where to start? No worries! In this hands-on session, build your own chrome plugin and host it online for others to see. And code the basics of Vue.js while at it. A win-win situation. How awesome is that!

4. "Vuejs Community, Q&A" by Chris Fritz (Educator/engineer hybrid, Vuejs) core team member and curator of vue docs.)
events.how_to_find_us: Walking distance from Saket Metro Station

events.name: Google I/O 2018 Extended, New Delhi
events.description:

Update 2 - Registration forms rolled out

This is an invite only based event!

Update 1 - The agenda is out! This time, we'll be having I/O extended at 3 locations to cater to the huge community in Delhi/NCR

I/O Extended Agenda:

UrbanClap, Gurgaon

10:30 - 11 : Registration
11 - 11:25 : Opening Note
11:30 - 12:20 : Introduction To The World Of Instant Apps & App Bundlers - Anupam Singh & Tushar Gupta- www.linkedin.com/in/anupamsingh0211 :: https://www.linkedin.com/in/tushar-gupta-b6887219/

13:00 - 13:30 : Lunch
13:30 - 13:40 : Surprise! Keep your phones ready :)
13:40 - 14:20 : "Why Flutter is the framework developers deserve, but also the one they need right now?” - Rohan Taneja - www.twitter.com/rohantaneja_
14:25 - 14:55 : Website Optimisation for Marketing & User Experience - Pranjal Nadhani - www.github.com/urbanclap-engg
14:55 - 15:30 : Community Mixer

SocialCops, New Delhi

10:30 - 11 : Registration
11 - 11:25 : Opening Note
11:30 - 12:15 : Getting started with Tensorflow's high level API - Akash Tandon - www.linkedin.com/in/akashtandon
12:20 - 13:00 : UX Writing and Customer Experience - Sayyam Sachdev - www.linkedin.com/in/sayyamsachdev
13:00 - 13:30 : Lunch
13:30 - 13:40 : Surprise! Keep your phones ready :)
13:40 - 14:20 : Firebase for web and Web developers - Neha Sharma - www.twitter.com/hellonehha
14:25 - 14:55 : Innovations and trends in Design Research - Whats coming next in 5 years - Supratim Chakraborty - www.linkedin.com/in/chakrabortysupratim
14:55 - 15:30 : Community Mixer

91Springboard, Sector 1, Noida

10:30 - 11 : Registration
11 - 11:25 : Opening Note
11:30 - 12:15 : Building for The Real India - Aman Gautam - www.linkedin.com/in/amangautam/
12:20 - 12:40 : Saving lives using android as a technology - Jubin Mathai & Pravin Prasad - www.aeologic.com
12:40 - 1:05 : Go Serverless with Google Firebase - Vasu Gupta - www.linkedin.com/in/vasugupta22
13:00 - 13:30 : Lunch
13:30 - 13:40 : Surprise! Keep your phones ready :)
13:40 - 14:20 : Google Dialogflow - Shilpa Garg - http://linkedin.com/in/shilpa-garg-90618568
14:25 - 14:55 : Fail-proof your UX - Usability for everyone - Jagriti Pande - www.linkedin.com/in/jagritipande
14:55 - 15:30 : Community Mixer

PS: Registration forms would be rolled out today!

---

It's already been 10 years since it happened first time in 2008!

We at GDG & WTM New Delhi are Super Duper Duper (yes, the extra Duper) Excited to announce Google I/O Extended 2018 on 27th May, 2018.

"Innovation in the Open", that's what I/O is about. And we're already looking to have a great day at multiple locations across Delhi - NCR.

We will be rolling out the registration forms soon this week! Stay tuned to this page for more updates on the awesome sessions and speakers.

Also, if you're looking to share with the community by delivering a session, please make sure you fill this form by 1st May, 2018: https://goo.gl/forms/YTgLwzdy7Y7VWuOc2

Again, stay tuned for more updates!

events.name: Flutter Extended 2018
events.description:
Code your first Flutter app! [In Just 3 Hours]

Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time.

Come join us at Flutter Extended if you haven't started using this great cross platform framework, where you'll build your first app in 3 hours.

To know more about Flutter, visit flutter.io

[UPDATE: 20th June, 2018]

This time, the registration process is a little different and more interesting. This has been done to ensure that we focus on making the app more than setting up the project!

In the form below, there's a field to enter the "Flutter basic project GitHub URL". This URL should be of the default Flutter project that gets created automatically when you create a new Flutter project in your IDE. We want you to show us that you've got Flutter setup on your laptop and you're ready to build your first app on the day of the event without having any setup issues.

LINK TO REGISTRATION FORM: https://goo.gl/forms/M3dA0QoS1mYnj8Tx2

Before filling the form, please follow the following steps:

1. Setup Flutter from here: https://flutter.io/get-started/install/
2. Push the code to a new Github Repository (public)
3. Fill the registration form (paste the link of the repository in step 2) in the form field

You're all done! Submit the form.

HINT: If you've pushed your code successfully, your repo should resemble this one: https://github.com/rohan20/gdg_nd_sample

For those of you who have already begun building Flutter apps, we'll be having advanced Flutter CodeLabs for you in the future :)

events.name: Actions on Google

venue.name: SocialCops
venue.address_1: 3rd Floor, Building No. 261, Lane No 5, Westend Marg, Said-ul-Ajaib, Saket, Saiyad ul Ajaib, Sainik Farm, New Delhi, Delhi 11003

events.description:
GDG New Delhi and WTM are thrilled to host their upcoming event "Actions on Google" on 15th and 22nd July.

Actions on Google is a developer platform that lets you create software to extend the functionality of the Google Assistant, Google's virtual personal assistant, across more than 500 million devices, including smart speakers, phones, cars, TVs, headphones, and more.
We invite the developer community to learn about creating Actions for the Google Assistant. Packed with engaging talks and interactive codelabs, the events will surely be memorable for developers who are eager learn more about the exciting new technologies that are coming up.

#IndiaBuildsActions
#SolveForIndia
#GoogleAssistant

Agenda:

July 15, 2018
Venue: SocialCops, Saket

10:00- 10:30 : Registrations
10:30 -11:00 : Introduction & Meetup Agenda discussion
11:00 - 1:00 : ‘Building Actions on Google’ Codelab by Alkesh Srivastava (www.linkedin.com/in/alkeshsrivastava11/)
1:00 - 1:45 : Lunch
1:45 - 2:20 : Fun Activity
2:20 - 3:20 : Recognising text using Google Cloud ML by Tushar Srivastava (www.linkedin.com/in/tushar-srivastava-305a05148/)
3:20 - 4:00 : Networking

July 15, 2018 - July 21, 2018
Code your Action to #SolveForIndia

July 22, 2018
Venue: SocialCops, Saket
Timings: 11am-4pm
1. Demo
2. Submit your action to the event console
3. Rewards by GDG and WTM Delhi to top actions

Deadline to Register : Wednesday(11th July, 2018) 10.00am

Here is the link to register: https://goo.gl/forms/GfN6oPpvVuKdBImv2

Apps submitted to console that #SolveForIndia will be selected by Google to demo their actions to influencers in the ecosystem in a mega event in mid September.

events.name: Instant Apps & PWA
events.description:
GDG & WTM New Delhi in collaboration with Jabong & Myntra are excited to announce the next event 'Instant Apps & PWA' on 29th September, 2018.

It's been a long time since we last met, and so this one's going to be a day filled with hands on CodeLab, product demos of the amazing apps and tools built by Jabog inhouse by their experts.

There's going to be a CodeLab on Instant Apps, a case study on PWA, a journey through the voice experience on Jabong app, a glance through the inhouse push notifications and finally, a talk on product classification.

Location: Jabong, Corporate Office, 82A, Sector 18, Sector 18, Gurugram, Haryana[masked]

Link to Register: https://gdgnd.org/gdg-new-delhi/fill-form?data_form_entity_id=9

Registration forms are out and we've got very limited seats!

*As always, registration is just the first part of the process, so, stay tuned for further communications!

events.name: IWD 19
events.description:
Registration: https://commudle.com/gdg-new-delhi/fill-form?data_form_entity_id=40

International Women’s Day (IWD) is marked on March 8th every year. In different regions, the focus of celebrations ranges from general respect and appreciation toward women to a celebration of women’s economic, political, and social achievements. We are here to celebrate women in Tech!

events.description:

TensorFlow

Microservices Architecture

A day filled with CodeLabs and Sessions!

Link to register: https://commudle.com/gdg-new-delhi/events/web-developer-days-3

events.name: I/O Extended 19
events.description:
It's already been 11 years since it happened first time in 2008!

We at GDG & WTM New Delhi are Super Duper Duper (yes, the extra Duper) Excited to announce Google I/O Extended 2019 on 26th May, 2019.

"Innovation in the Open", that's what I/O is about. And we're already looking to have a great day at multiple locations across Delhi - NCR.

We will be rolling out the registration forms soon! Stay tuned to this page for more updates on the awesome sessions and speakers.

Registrations are open Now!!!!
Here's the link:
https://commudle.com/gdg-new-delhi/fill-form?data_form_entity_id=125

Again, stay tuned for more updates!

events.name: DevFest 2019
events.description:
DevFest'19, our yearly fest, is a really special event for us. It describes both, 'The Community Spirit' and 'The Developer Spirit' to keep learning, sharing and developing solutions together.

This year it's going to be shaped like a tech conference with experts from a number of domains including Web, Cloud, Android, Flutter, AR/VR, Security, Firebase, ML, Python, IoT, Design, UX, UI, Kotlin and the list continues.

What's more? Obviously, goodies!

There's going to be a number of activities in and around the event, be sure to participate!

PS. You'll need your Unique Entry Pass to attend.

More details: https://commudle.com/gdg-new-delhi/events/devfest-19

And, it's a FREE, Invite Only Event!
